revision.text:
{{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=07:05, 29 April 2011 (UTC) |action1link=Talk:Operation Kita/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=424333415 |action2=WAR |action2date=06:38, 2 June 2011 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Operation Kita |action2result=approved |action2oldid=429835453 |action3=FAC |action3date=20:13, 4 August 2011 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Operation Kita/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=442658574 |dykdate= 31 March 2011 |dykentry=... that during '''[[Operation Kita]]''' in {{Nowrap|February 1945}}, six [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] warships, sailing from [[Singapore]] to [[Japan]], evaded the 26 [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] submarines which were positioned to attack them? |four=yes |currentstatus=FA |maindate=February 10, 2014 |topic=war }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|B1=yes|B2=yes|B3=yes|B4=yes|B5=yes|Maritime=y|British=y|Japanese=y|US=y|WWII=y|Majestic-Titan=3|A-Class=pass}} }} == Naval Victory or a successful naval operation == Doesn't this rank as a "successful naval operation" like the [[Channel Dash]] of ''Scharnhorst, Gneisenau'' and ''Prince Eugen'' rather than a "naval victory" (which implies a significant clash of forces with a victor)? --[[Special:Contributions/184.2.231.10|184.2.231.10]] ([[User talk:184.2.231.10|talk]]) 12:58, 10 February 2014 (UTC) ==Name of operation== Japanese Wikipedia, at least, refers to this as "Operation Hoku" (''hoku'' being the ''on'yomi'', or alternate reading, for the character åŒ—). [[User:Brutannica|Brutannica]] ([[User talk:Brutannica|talk]]) 16:43, 10 February 2014 (UTC)
Novice users like me cannot change it, while nowadays literally everyone in western-language communities are using the wrong name. The Japanese pronunciation is indeed "Hoku-Go Sakusen", as Brutannica mentioned above. Please, someone with the authority to change the title, please do so ASAP, before even more people get the wrong idea. [[User:Vcharng|Vcharng]] ([[User talk:Vcharng|talk]]) 15:40, 4 November 2015 (UTC)
